Luis Raul Weber Abramo

Bolsista de Produtividade em Pesquisa do CNPq - Nível 1C

  • Endereço para acessar este CV: http://lattes.cnpq.br/4558796258762790
  • Última atualização do currículo em 29/07/2019

I graduated in Physics at the Universidade de São Paulo, and I have a Ph. D. in Physics from Brown University (1997). I was a post-doctoral fellow at the University of Florida, and at the Ludwig-Maximilians Universität (Munich, Germany). I have also been a visiting fellow at Princeton University and at the University of Pennsylvania. Presently I am an Associate Professor (III) of Physics at the Departamento de Física Matemática, Instituto de Física, Universidade de São Paulo. My work started in theoretical cosmology, inflation and cosmological perturbations. More recently I have been working on phenomenological and observational aspects of cosmology and astrophysics, especially those related to astrophysical surveys. My main current topics of research include the structure formation, galaxy evolution, photometric redshifts, quasars, dark matter, dark energy and modified gravity. I have been involved with astrophysical surveys for a few years, and since 2018 I am a member of the Collaboration Board of J-PAS, as the representative from USP. I am also committed to popularizing science through appearances dedicated to the general public in schools, universities, museums, libraries, and inter-disciplinary events. (Texto informado pelo autor)

Projetos de pesquisa
2016 - 2017
Explorando novas fronteiras com levantamentos de galáxias
Descrição: Projeto de Auxilio Regular à Pesquisa FAPESP, Processo No. 2015/17199-0.
Situação: Concluído; Natureza: Pesquisa.
Alunos envolvidos: Graduação: (1) / Mestrado acadêmico: (1) / Doutorado: (1) .

Integrantes: Luis Raul Weber Abramo - Coordenador.
Financiador(es): Fundação de Amparo à Pesquisa do Estado de São Paulo - Auxílio financeiro.
2013 - 2017
The 3-D Universe: Astrophysics with Large Galaxy Surveys
Descrição: Large galaxy surveys, either spectroscopic or photometric, are changing the landscape of Astronomy, since they are the best strategy to understand one of the most profound mysteries of contemporary cosmology: the nature of dark energy, the dominant component of the Universe, responsible for the acceleration of its expansion. From a cosmological perspective, galaxy redshift surveys are necessary to build 3-D maps of the galaxy distribution, which can then be used to estimate cosmological parameters through statistical studies of features imprinted in this distribution. The nature of dark energy is actually only one of the many scientific challenges that may be pursued with large surveys. In fact, as exemplified by the Sloan Digital Sky Survey (SDSS), which is regarded as the most productive project of all time in Astronomy, galaxy redshift or photometric surveys are powerful tools to study from asteroids in the Solar System to our own Galaxy, from galaxy evolution to the large-scale structures of the Universe. Indeed, large galaxy surveys are the most efficient way (if not the only one) to approach properly some of the big challenges of contemporary astronomy. At present, we are currently participating in the design of two new surveys: the Javalambre Physics of the Accelerating Universe Astrophysical Survey (J-PAS) and the Prime Focus Spectrograph for the Subaru Measurement of Images and Redshifts survey (PFS/SuMIRe ). Their potential is enormous from both the scientific and technological point of view. We already have graduate students and post-docs developing projects which have these surveys in mind. We also have strongparticipation in the development of instruments for these surveys: the panoramic CCD camera of J-PAS and the optical fiber sub-system for PFS/SuMIRe. The objective of this Thematic Project is twofold: i) to consolidate our scientific work with galaxy surveys, and ii) to obtain the funding in order to build the optical fiber sub-system of the PFS/SuM.
Situação: Concluído; Natureza: Pesquisa.
Alunos envolvidos: Graduação: (4) / Mestrado acadêmico: (5) / Doutorado: (5) .

Integrantes: Luis Raul Weber Abramo - Integrante / Laerte Sodré Junior - Coordenador.
Financiador(es): Fundação de Amparo à Pesquisa do Estado de São Paulo - Auxílio financeiro.
2010 - 2016
Galaxy evolution in the era of large surveys
Descrição: Understanding how galaxies form and evolve remains one of the most significant problems in Astrophysics. To meet this challenge, our group has developed a technique of spectral synthesis, the empirical population synthesis, which allows to identify the dominant stellar populations of galaxies from the analysis of their spectra. This technique is suitable for the analysis of data produced by large surveys that cover large areas on the sky and that became essential tools to efficiently address several problems of contemporary astrophysics and cosmology. We have applied this technique to SDSS data, examining several properties of the galaxy population from studies involving nearly a million spectra. In this project we wish to extend our empirical synthesis approach to high redshift and actively participate in the design and implementation of two new spectroscopic and photometric surveys, J-PAS (Javalambre Physics of the Accelerating Universe Survey) and SuMIRe (Subaru Measurement of Images and Redshifts). The latter will be conducted with the aid of a new spectrograph, the PFS (Prime Focus Spectrograph), in which construction we were invited to participate. Our goal with this project is to obtain resources to enable the effective development of these activities and, especially, allow us to develop a preliminary study of a PFS sub-system called FOCCOS, involving the optical fibres and their connectors, which will provide the optical interface between the telescope and the spectrograph. Although the main objective of these two surveys is the study of dark energy, they must bring invaluable contributions to several areas of modern astronomy, including galaxy evolution..
Situação: Concluído; Natureza: Pesquisa.

Integrantes: Luis Raul Weber Abramo - Integrante / de Oliveira, Claudia Mendes - Integrante / Laerte Sodré Junior - Coordenador.
Financiador(es): Fundação de Amparo à Pesquisa do Estado de São Paulo - Auxílio financeiro.
2010 - Atual
J-PAS Astrophysical Survey
Descrição: J-PAS (Javalambre Physics of the Accelerating Universe Astrophysical Survey) is a large-area medium-band optical survey that will map > 200 million galaxies, millions of quasars, thousands of Supernovas and many other types of solar system, galactic and extragalactic objects. One of the main aims of J-PAS is to measure the expansion rate of the Universe using the baryonic acoustic oscillation (BAO) features to percent-level accuracy. The goal is for this project to become the first Stage III/Stage IV astrophysical survey (in the nomenclature of the Dark Energy Task Force, Albrecht et al. 2009). I have been involved since the inception of the brazilian project to build the cameras for J-PAS, and I am presently one of the Coordinators (together witl N. Benítez and R. Dupke) of the Observational Cosmology Working Group (which coordinates the work of many Science Working Groups). I am also actively involved with the Science Working Groups on Theoretical Cosmology, on Supernovas, and on Quasars & AGNs. In Spain, J-PAS is supported by CSIC, CEFCA and the State Government of Aragón. In Brazil, J-PAS is supported by MCT/ON, FINEP, FAPESP (Proc. 2010/17649-1, 2011/18729-1 and 2012/00800-4) and FAPERJ..
Situação: Em andamento; Natureza: Pesquisa.
Alunos envolvidos: Graduação: (10) / Mestrado acadêmico: (10) / Doutorado: (10) .

Integrantes: Luis Raul Weber Abramo - Integrante / Renato Dupke - Coordenador / de Oliveira, Claudia Mendes - Integrante / Laerte Sodré Junior - Integrante / Narciso Benitez - Integrante.
Financiador(es): Fundação de Amparo à Pesquisa do Estado de São Paulo - Auxílio financeiro.
Número de produções C, T & A: 7 / Número de orientações: 10

2003 - 2007
Cosmic microwave background constraints on dark energy models
Descrição: We developed a numerical code (Q-CMBFAST) based on the existing code by Seljak & Zaldarriaga (1996) to compute the CMB anisotropies in generalized dark energy models. We also developed tools to study the observational constraints from experiments such as WMAP and Planck..
Situação: Concluído; Natureza: Pesquisa.
Alunos envolvidos: Mestrado acadêmico: (1) .

Integrantes: Luis Raul Weber Abramo - Coordenador / Pereira, Thiago S - Integrante / Finelli, Fabio - Integrante.

Apoios financeiros recebidos:
*** 1993-97: Bolsa de Doutorado na Brown University (E.U.A.) 
*** 1997-99: Bolsa de pos-doutoramento do U.S. Department of Energy na Universidade da Florida (E.U.A.) 
*** 1999-01: Bolsa de pesquisa de pos-doutoramento do DFG (Governo Alemao) na Universidade de Munique (Alemanha)
*** 2003-2006: Pesquisador associado a Projeto Temático FAPESP
*** 2003,2004,2007: Bolsa do CNR (Itália) para visitas à Universidade de Bolonha e ao IASF/INAF
*** 2004-2009: Pesquisador da Colaboração Internacional NSF-CNPq, entre IF-USP, IAG-USP, IFT-UNESP, IF-UFRJ, Universidade de Chicago e FERMILAB (E.U.A.)
*** 2005-2006: Bolsa da CNRS (França) para visita de longa duração ao Institute D'Astrophysique de Paris
*** 2005-2007: Coordenador do Projeto Universal CNPq 475376/04-8
*** 2006-2009: Pesquisador da Colaboração Internacional Brasil/França (CAPES/COFECUBE)
*** 2006-2010: Pesquisador Principal de Projeto Temático FAPESP
*** 2008-2014: Pesquisador Principal e Membro do Comitê Científico do INCT de Astrofísica. Coordenador: João E. Steiner (IAG/USP)
*** 2010-2010: Bolsa de pós-doutoramento do CNPq na Princeton University (E.U.A.)
*** 2010-2011: Bolsa de Pesquisa no Exterior da FAPESP na University of Pennsylvannia (E.U.A.)
*** 2013-2017: Pesquisador Principal de Projeto Temático FAPESP
*** 2014-2018: Membro do programa de intercâmbio USP/Princeton University
*** 2016-2017: Coordenador de Projeto de Auxílio Regular à Pesquisa da FAPESP
*** 2017-presente: Pesquisador Principal de Projeto Temático FAPESP
### 2010-presente: Membro Fundador (builder), membro representante da USP no Collaboration Board do levantamento astrofísico J-PAS (colaboração Brasil-Espanha, no valor total de aprox. 30 milhões de euros) e coordenador dos grupos de Observational Cosmology e Quasars & AGNs. ###
